Author: tigerchik
Text: 1. Reward yourself - a present for completing some predetermined number of meals in their entirety, or for NOT engaging in particular habits you're trying to break. Should probably be non-food-related rewards, like new nail polish (or whatever brings you joy). 2. Think long-term about your values. I value being able to go out to eat with my brother and not stressing over it, for example, and sitting through feeling uncomfortable in other situations (e.g. trying new foods) were stepping stones that contributed to my current ability to be able to go out to eat. 3. Distractions while eating like crossword puzzles etc.
